Type.Name: RequiredAttributeAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit RequiredAttributeAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Enum | System.AttributeTargets.Interface | System.AttributeTargets.All, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)

remarks.para: You can apply this attribute to classes, structures, enumerations, and interfaces.

For example, you can use this attribute to mark a C++ class that has a copy constructor. Any compiler that uses such a class must understand every constraint on its use, such as never creating an object of that class in the garbage collected heap, because a relocation does not call its copy constructor.
The classes in are for compiler writers use only.

summary.para: Specifies that an importing compiler must fully understand the semantics of a type definition, or refuse to use it. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type requiredContract) cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: A type that an importing compiler must fully understand.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'Type'

remarks.para: This property is not supported in the .NET Framework version 2.0 and later.

summary.para: Gets a type that an importing compiler must fully understand.
